task_description: Facing the building to your North (approx. 11°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the roofline and full vertical extent of the north-facing main building, so I should tilt the camera upward first without changing position.
I can see the upper façade/roofline now, but to estimate total height I need the ground-to-roof span, so I should tilt down to include the base while keeping the building centered.
With the base and much of the façade visible, I can estimate the building as roughly 3 stories plus roof (about 10–12 m), so I'll provide a single best estimate.
